Went here with my wife for lunch and had a great time.  I wanted a british beer so I just told the waitress to surprise me and that she did.  It was excellent.  I ordered the fish and chips and was not disappointed.  HUGE chunks of fish and it was light and flaky and I enjoyed the heck out of it.  My wife on the other had ordered a lamb stew that was very very lamby, and I love lamb but when I tasted it, it made me jerk my head.  I had that lamb smell in my nose so I had to chow down on my fish and vinegar goodness.  It was fun though.

Recently enjoyed another dinner on their patio with my lovin' man. This time, we both were in a breakfast kind of mood, so went for the Gammon and Eggs. Gammon is similar to ham, but the British version is called gammon and is a bit milder than American ham, and the steaks are generally round in shape with a center bone. Eggs were cooked properly, although I wish our plates had been served a little hotter. Overall, another great meal at Crown & Anchor on Trop.

It was a great breakfast, and their great coffee worked beautifully with it to squelch our hankerin' for breakfast.

Possibly one of the most authentic fish-and-chips in Las Vegas - the only thing missing - the meal properly wrapped in a British newspaper and a cockney speaking bladdered* gooner**

This pub has character. Although it has not been opened for long ( I think I saw something that said 1980s or 90s), it feels like its been around for a very long time.

The dining room is very small and when its at capacity you'll have to wait for a table.  Your best bet is to get a seat at the bar.  At the time of my visit, the waitresses were a bit overwhelmed.  We told the waitress that we'd wait for a table at the bar.  I guess she forgot about us because she sat a party that came though the door before sitting us who were waiting; so, we just opted for sitting at the bar.  

The bar tender on the other hand, was super nice.  He ended taking our order and noticing that our food had not come out, compensated our wait with a beer.

Of note is the locals and their understated like for the video poker.  Keep an eye on them, its fun to watch them play.

*bladdered = very drunk
**gooner = Arsenal fan (Arsenal is a football team in England)

Dude. The atmosphere of this place is top notch. The food, and drink is excellent. Monday's are all you can eat fish and chips, and it's probably the best in town. They are a great place, if you love watching soccer, you will be in ultimate heaven.

Forget the more American offerings on the menu.  Just have the fish and chips--with mushy peas.  Dip your chips in the mushy peas instead of the tartar sauce.  Their fish and chips are perfection, and English-style perfection at that.

Horrible time! I have been going to C&A for 6 year now. I haven't been for about 4 months. Today I went to watch the Arsenal vs. West Ham match at 5:30am. The place was packed with about 12 Arsenal supporters and about 10-12 West Ham supporters. The bartender was a complete tool and acted like he owned the place. He was obviously messed up on something. It took him forever to get our drinks. When the game started he still had to jukebox playing over the audio system. Several people started asking him to put the game audio on. He kept making that fingers rubbing together money signal like we needed to pay him. Finally I cornered him coming out of the kitchen and asked him to put the audio on. In a quick response he said "If you pay me." I threw $2 at him and said here take it. It then took him 10 minutes to get it working. He's a complete tool and thinks he runs this place. Horrible experience and I doubt I will ever be back. I have watched dozens of matches in the place and it has gone to shit. The problem is all the cabbies drop tourists off at this place and there really isn't another football bar in Vegas that I know of. Super annoying and I am pissed off about the bartender. I have been several other times when he's working and its a complete buzz kill. Its a complete shame because this place could be cool.

Came here to watch Manchester Unites play today. This place is great to watched the matches. They are open 24 hours so you can catch any game(even the ones at 4am). They have good prices on food and drinks. They also have a great draft selection.

My friends and I had lunch here yesterday for the first time ever.  Some very interesting English items on the menu and some I've never had before.
Let's start with the pasty that one of the diners had. I can't comment truthfully on this because the pasties that I've had all my life living in Michigan are made differently but these were still good. So I'm just partial to the different way of making them.  Have to admit they were large and well-made with a generous amount of mashed potatoes and brown gravy.  Forgot to mention we started with a cup of their incredibly delicious creamed cabbage and Stilton soup. Wow! 

The rest of us had their much touted fish and chips and that I can tell you I've had many,many times in many,  many places but these were exceptionally good.
One very large,  thick piece of perfectly done, fresh Icelandic cod lightly breaded-and one was enough. One diner and I substituted the fries for onion rings which we both loved.  The fish and chips come with a generous portion of peas... Very English indeed.
Service was outstanding from the minute we walked in until the minute we left. Our waitress Jessica was not only very friendly and outgoing but treated us like guests in her home.  We definitely will go back and we hope we get Jessica again.
I would recommend the Crown and Anchor.

Looking for dinner while on a business trip. sort of lost, saw this place and stopped out of aggrivation. Small and quaint beer and dart bar with a great British menu. Server (Sarah) was very nice and the food was delicious. Get the meat mushroom pie. Came with whipped mashed potatoes and veggies. Plenty of beers to chose from. Outside is run down, but inside is clean and nice. Got lucky here.

We both went for fish and chips,  what a major disappointment,  we got one piece of flavorless fish with fries and undercooked peas.  They didn't even drain the peas sufficiently,  so now the breaded flavorless fish and fries are soggy from the pea juice.  The waitress only came by once to check on us at the end of our meal. My wife had to twice walk to the bar to get her water refilled.  
All we got was a,  "sorry,  that is our feature dish',.  Now that was scary if that's their best plate!

Wow I used to love this place. I just went there and it took me 25 minutes to get my first drink 30 minutes to get my food 20 minutes for each round of beverages and it took me 45 minutes to get my bill at the end , come on...... I think it is because I was not sitting at the bar , I was sitting at one of the few slot machines on the side. Everyone at the bar was getting fast service . The bartenders were either neglecting the waitresses or the waitress that I had just forgot to put in my orders... I dunno!!

Richard it was the same day I arrived there at around 9 PM

I recently started going to Crown & Anchor because of a suggestion from a friend. We usually go to the one on Spring Mtn, but this one is closer to my house. For a Friday night around 10pm, this place was moderately packed. 
Let me start off by saying that THE ONLY REASON I come to Crown & Anchor is because of the Snakebite. I would come here everyday if I could for this  damn drink. I never in my life had liked beer so much until I found this tasty delight. Both locations have darts which is always a fun activity to do with a group of people too. A friend of mine also ordered this dish that included Home Made Potato Chips which were a hit at our table.

I can't say better things about Crown and Anchor. A+ to them.
If you are looking for an authentic British pub you found it. Sausage rolls amazing, scotch eggs and fish & chips good. I come here everytime I come to Vegas.

Things I like about the Crown & Anchor:
The location (off the strip, but not too far off, close enough to walk to Thomas & Mack for bball games)
The beer selection (Chimay on tap is pretty rare in LV)
They have darts and a jukebox.

Things that are just ok:
The parking situation (not too many spots, especially tight on game day, you usually have to park at the paint store or the llantera and hope you don't get towed).
The food (burgers and fish & chips are decent)
The prices (reasonable, but I wish happy hour went past 6)
The ambiance (pub-ish)
The service (sometimes good, sometimes slow)

Thing I hate:
The smoking! (yes, they still allow it!)

Giving this place an extra star because our server was really sweet. We came with a large group of about 15 people and they sat us in the upstairs area next to a foreboding "Max. Occupancy: 9" sign. Luckily, we all survived the experience, but the service was exceptionally slow and the food was pretty disappointing. I thought you could never go wrong with fish & chips at a British pub, but mine didn't have any flavor at all. The server felt bad that we had to wait so long so she brought us all plates of "chip butties" which are just french fries on a buttered roll. Don't knock it til you try it... that was actually better than most of our meals.

This place does seem fun as a bar since they had Monday night football on and people were very into it.

I'm American, but I lived in the U.K. for 8 years during the 1990s, and I must say that THIS is the best British pub - both in ambience and in genuiness of food - that I have found, or probably ever will find in the States.

I've tried the scotch egg, sausage roll and fish and chips when I have gone there (3 times, so far), and they are spot on - none of this fake "We'll CALL it a pub and give the silly Yanks what they *think* is "British" food, which is really just American food" mentality of so many pseudo English/Irish/whateverish "pubs" - this is the real deal - or as real as customs will allow.

You must try the fish and chips - get them with mushy peas, because that's good!

The other thing I've loved about this pub is that you never see any kids there - as a child-free person, this is refreshing and so much more enjoyable than wondering if little Bratleigh will yell, scream, cry, run around and basically ruin everyone else's dinner - Bratleigh's somewhere else - GOD SAVE THE QUEEN!!!

And you immigrated Brits now living over here - you'll love this place!

I love this place. It is right around the corner from my house so it is easy to get to (for me). The food is good, not the greatest, but solid for sure. The place is more run down than it should be, the owner should look into touching it up. But if you are looking for a place with great staff this place is great. The bartenders and servers are so unique that it makes it fun every time. My friends and I go to Karaoke Wednesdays and Dollar PBR Sundays all the time.

I've only stopped by here for some drinks with a friend, so I haven't actually tasted the food. My vodka shots were smooth, but I just didn't have any room for food, so instead I just watched my husband and our friend chow down some scottish eggs and fish n' chips.. they loved it. And it's too bad that I wasn't hungry, but service was fast, girls working there were friendly, and seemed like authentic European food.. now I just need to find some place like that here in Arizona..

We have been in twice in the previous month to get a British staple: Fish & Chips.

The first time, we were not told it was AYCE until I saw the sign on our way out. My fish was cooked alright, smallish portions for the price, but not a horrible meal, just a bit overpriced for one serving.

This go around, we ordered the AYCE Fish & Chips and hoped for a filling meal. For over two hours we were at Crown & Anchor, we received our first PIECE of fish, granted, the one piece per plate was fairly substantial. However, it was still just one piece. Shortly after devouring that one piece, my stomach was screaming for more food. It was not until we had been at C&A for over an hour the second piece made its way out. That was it. Two pieces of fish in two hours. 

I feel places like this should change the name from "All You Can Eat" to "All We Decide To Serve".

Also, if you are a bar/restaurant... HOW DO YOU RUN OUT OF GLASSES?! The place was not even full and our server apologized multiple times for not being able to bring out drinks in a timely fashion and our friends that wanted a glass of ice to go with their bottled drinks could not have one because, "We're out of glasses." Seriously? There is a serious problem when a bar does not have enough glasses to cover a moderately busy night.
Wonderful place for a drink. Four ciders on tap. If you wear your scrubs on Wednesday you get a first free beer and discounts.

This is the undiscovered part of Vegas that should be known. I like the food & the atmosphere. The waitresses are uber sexy and the decor is classic British.  Very good fish & chips done right with a side of peas so the food is home style. Unfortunately, it suffers from a weird layout and it being in a shitty neighborhood. They do offer a British black taxi to pick you up from your hotel or house. Good parking too. Just watch your back & your wallet going in & out due to the crime ridden area its in.  If you're a beer drinker,then you'll like the "Down The Hatch" club which one has to earn to be in. 

I do like this place alot & will go there again.

I went for lunch today and I was excited to eat my first Yorkshire pudding. Unfortunately, it came out very over done to almost being burnt.  The Scotch egg with that great mustard dipping sauce was yummy.  Service was great !

Whenever I'm in Vegas and want to watch my Arsenal play I make sure to hit up the Crown & Anchor.  That means I'm showing up around 6 in the AM and I probably did not sleep at all the night before.

There's a great beer selection but I can't really comment on the food (although I've been told it's good) because each time I've been there I've been just way too drunk to remember anything except the Scotch Eggs.  And those are perfect for eating after you've downed a few pints.

The last time I was in Vegas we showed up at the C&A so early in the morning it was still dark.  We stayed all day as some lads from England were in town for a stag party (bachelor party to us Yanks) and we ended up drinking with them all day.  The staff was friendly and great fun to chat with the whole time as well (I think we may have even received a couple of free drinks).  By the time we left it was dark again.  

We didn't step out into the sun all day and we weren't even in a casino!
Had lunch today.  Fish and chips. Great bar service with a pretty lady with an awesome personality.   Games are good and a very  wide choice of draft beers.  Plenty of tv's.  Love it!

RUDE MANAGER. We (7 out of town guests) stopped there before a UNLV basketball game because it was recommended. We got SLOW service on a Saturday afternoon. When the manager said she would take care of it by comping our drinks (2nd round, waitress forgot one, then never brought it) she fooled me by charging my bank card anyway, without my signature!! Not the customers fault they only had one waitress on a game day. I will NEVER go back!!!!!! I will however call my bank.
If the outside patio is full, keep driving unless you enjoy smelling like an ashtray after eating inside.

Nice server very helpful played $20 on video poker and received full dinner no Yorkshire pudding like the menu said why do servers always forget stuff it happened the other night at Mimi's too when they forgot my wife's blueberry muffin with her quiche. I was there for a memorial of someone I know who died of alcoholism at age 52

I just came here for lunch had 2 smithwicks but not before having chicken fingers. I asked them to make them as hot as they can possibly make it which still isn't it hot enough for me, none the less they are amazing. I also had the garlic sauteed mushrooms in lu of french frys. Please try them, they will brighten your day, way better than french frys.

I know this is probably heresy but I have one word to sum up the crown and anchor: Meh.

I think to enjoy this place you need to be  A) in college and B) have never been to any other pub. Ever.

First off, I expect a pub to serve more than just beer and wine at the bar. To get hard alcohol (ie. Whiskey in my case) you have to sit in the dining area and order food.  Someone cheaped out on a real liquor license and just doesn't care at this point.

Second, the fish + chips I've tried twice here and its completely lackluster. Not worth the hype. It tastes frozen. The chips were mealy, both times. Very middle of the road. Maybe they had a better chef or food distributor a while back when it got voted #1 in Vegas, but there's far better elsewhere.

The jukebox was a little bit crap too. I heard the Police greatest hits for a little too long. Then it was followed by 1990's euro trash techno. Very blah.

On the upside: great atmosphere, great room, nice pool tables. If you're a major beer drinker, then you'll love it. The whiskey drinker in me was disappointed by their liquor policy.

Two words..rancid mayonnaise. Service was less than stellar for chicken curry and a turkey club to go. How could you go wrong? Got mayo packets in the bag with our meals, nothing out or the ordinary until I spread the mayo all over my sandwich. It spread like peanut butter. Uh oh.. I tasted it with my finger, it was BAD. *barf* Upon closer inspection, it had the consistency of cottage cheese that'd been left out in the sun. Trying not to gag, I brought my food back in. Was offered a replacement, which was acceptable since I was starving. Also was brought a fresh mayo, which I was told had been refrigerated. Why weren't the mayo packets put through the same treatment?? New turkey club wasn't great, I couldn't get the rancid mayo taste out of my mouth. Sorry, not coming back to order food ever again. :/
My favorite bar in Vegas! Great staff, food, and beer selection. Best fish and chips in town. Great place to watch sports, and the ONLY place to watch international soccer. Also love the uniforms.

Great little place, tasty grub and British fare. Exactly what it's trying to be. A piece of British civilization  inside the vast desert abyss. Came here for breakfast, because the prices are less than half of what they are on the strip. The service and food met my expectations. Cool little groove.

Nice place!  I lived in England for a time and developed a taste for British Ales so it is great to find a place that has them on tap here in Vegas.  I had the Sunday dinner special which was excellent.  Bar tenders are friendly.

I'm so glad we made it out to the Crown & Anchor.  Unfortunately the place doesn't look like much from the outside, but it was a real treat.  Great service, great food, great drinks, awesome prices.  It's a pub, so go into it with that in mind.  Happy hour draught  drinks!  I grew up on English food, and this meal reminded me of that.  Yorkshire pudding, with butter, gravy &/or honey-butter, to die for!  While we didn't have room, we still ordered the apple-crumble for dessert, and I'm glad we did.  Warm custard/pudding, with apple, and crumble, a real treat to end the meal.  Wish I had discovered this place earlier in our trip, as I would have frequented them more often.

Stopped in for the Monday night AYCE Fish & Chips special. Was bummed to learn that clam chowder wasn't on the menu every night. Would have loved to have had some. Fish was good but seemed that the outside was fried too much as there were hard crispy pieces that you didn't want to eat (in the fryer too long). Fish itself was flaky & not dried out. Not a fan of the peas that accompanied the dish. Chips were good as well.

Pretty good, but there's a reason the Brits aren't known for their food. Great beer selection, good sausage, other food items were standard meat and potatoes selections at OK prices.  Seemed past it's prime a bit, but I think that may have added some charm more than anything.
Been looking for good authentic fish and chips. I really enjoyed it. Staff are nice too.

So I came to this place after reading the reviews here on Yelp and planning an annual trip I make with my father.  I wanted to find some good local places, off the strip, where the food was neither buffet nor over-priced.  Their meat pies were top notch, the cider was fresh, the beer was priced well and they carried a lot of imported foods that are hard to find most places.  Being an off strip place - it seems to cater to locals and I really liked that.  The first waitress was fabulous - fast, attentive and smiley.  The second was very friendly but much slower and less on top of things.  However she was adequate.  The only draw back to this place was how smokey it smelled - but its vegas and the law says you can smoke in the pubs so...
This is a place I will definitely frequent again when I am in town.  In terms of being traditional, I am a first generation Canadian, raised by a family of Brits and I can say this is good authentic style pub.  WELL DONE!

Can't rave enough about the staff and the Bartender Rob and the sweet waitresses! They even have #Glutenfree #DedicatedFryers and omg if ever gluten allergy person isn't compelled to come here at least once a week for the best GF steak fries, then they're all crazy!

Update: So I've continued to head to this place in an effort to finish my beer cards. I've managed to finish two cards and am Card No. 3! Tracy has been incredible in knowing which beer to random select for me.

Then again, all of the staff is great and I'm glad they're continuing to provide me with a great experience.

This place is the closest Las Vegas will get to a college bar. The place is modeled after an English pub situated in a large wooden hall. They have a variety of beers on tap and after you've had them all (all 30), they'll give you some kind of Crown and Anchor swag. 

Thought it was kinda weird that the place was filled with seats. In other cities, a type of bar like this would also double as a club haha. That wouldn't fly in Vegas I suppose.

If you're a local and looking for a chill time with a very young and college scene, come here. No grimy old man pedos. 

If you're a tourist and you've ventured this far from the strip, you'll find this place a comforting and unpretentious bar to pass the time.

Minus one star for the service which is also very collegy.

Still loving Crown & Anchor. 

As a Vegas-native now living in the UK I can say that Crown & Anchor is definitely the closest experience to an English pub I have ever seen in Vegas. Such a great place to just sit around, drink some beer, eat some food (curry! scotch egg! pies! bangers!) and not be rushed or expected to hurry, eat, leave.

Find yourself a nice quiet corner, bring the newspaper, order a beer and a bowl of stilton cabbage soup and laze the day away. As stated before avoid evenings and weekends if you dont want to run into the lame college crowd.

So it's a pretty good English-y tavern, augmented with Vegas' love for gambling.  But if you don't sit at the bar proper, you can barely tell any of that's there.  There's a few TVs up to watch a match, lots of beer on tap (the English assortment of 1664 and Carlsburg), and you can order a large baseball of meat wrapped in a buttery shell.   Oh wait, that's a Cornish Pastie!  And it's delicious.  

Did I mention the wait staff is hot?

Normally I do provide reviews, however my experience last night 31 Mar 2016 warrants it.  First off, the server was attentive and brought food and drinks timely.  The beer was cold and the food  was outstanding as all agreed to, by our party of 4.  However, after eating and waiting for the bill to arrive my friends noticed a HUGE cockroach on my shirt that had come out from the dark recesses of under the table to say hello.  We immediately went to the hostess station to complain and one of the waitresses said "oh you met Jeff huh?"  Obviously Jeff the cockroach is part of the experience.  Therefore, if you wish to share your dinner with more friends than you knew you had, go here.  Otherwise pass!

Our favorite pub in Las Vegas.

Good food, great beer and close to the Strip. Make it a point to go!

If you like good beer and need a place to watch a sporting event (Easily the best place to watch soccer matches in town), then you've come to the right place. Nothing spectacular for food. I tried the chicken fingers based on other reviewers suggestions and I would say they're a little better than your average. They give you hot sauce with them, which is probably why they were good. I would rate their game day atmosphere a 5 but the food a 3.

We were staying at Bluegreen Club 36 which is very near UNLV and loved the idea of going someplace off the Strip.  We went for dinner on a Wednesday night and it was very popular but we didn't have to wait very long.  The food was good - I love Scotch Eggs and also the chicken and leek pie was delicious! Good choice of beer.  Lots of students but we were weren't the only ones there who weren't.  Fun atmosphere, good service. We'd definitely go back again if we ever return to Vegas.
Last time I was here was back in 93, hasn't changed much and neither has the fish n chips...outstanding as usual. I grew in the UK and familiar with pubs, this feels like home.

Ugh!  So we had to take a cab to get here because we didn't want to have to trek down Tropicana Avenue ten blocks only to get rolled.  Once we got there we realized something horrifying:  the air conditioner was BARELY on!  Then to make matters even worse NOBODY took our order for a good TEN MINUTES while we sat there (yes, I DID keep track, thank you!)...

So why the HELL would I give such a lame place four stars?  Probably 4.5 to be exact?  Because C&A is just what I miss about London and definitely lived up to high expectations!

Decor is wild.  Definitely reminded me of the drunken stumbles around Notting Hill during World Cup '06.  It felt VERY pub-esque and I loved it so much.  Beer selection is...  eh?  Well let's just say that if you love them English-style beers then you're in heaven.  It was hard to break from the black and tans (especially for hopheads like my brother and myself) so we didn't -- which was fine.  LOTS of weekly specials...  Kind of makes me wish I was either a UNLV student or a casino industry worker.  Or that at least I lived around here to make it out for their occasional food and drink specials.  Or at least to be able to enjoy soccer (sorry, but there is already another sport in this country called 'football' ... TM Justin Timberlake @ the ESPYs) on the numerous TVs.  But the food, jeez, the FOOD!!!

Fish and chips.  Cod was fried EXACTLY the way we love it -- and my bro and I BOTH agreed that it's way better than the Olde Ship's (British pub-ish place here in Orange County) fish.  Thin, crispy outside, flaky yumminess of fish on the inside.  Tartar sauce was perfect.  Fries were perfect.  We chose to throw most of the peas into my chicken curry.  Speaking of which...  chicken curry!  Kind of what I expected -- not spicy, good flavor -- but soooo much food!  I chose to order it on the rice since my brother already had chips.  Good call.  Perfect consistency in the potatoes, LOVED the mushrooms, chunks of chicken were a good size.  It was just SO FILLING!

The night's ultimate experience, however, came in the form of an impromptu "Today's Special" dessert:  the sticky toffee pudding was proudly displayed on the night's chalkboard.  Sooo...  what were we to do?  And DEAR GAWD did we make an excellent decision.  The toffee sauce is TO DIE FOR.  I absolutely despise raisins but I stuffed them in my mouth as far as this culinary sinfulness was concerned.  Bread pudding-ish + buttery toffee moat + whipped cream + raisins = one of the most delightful sweets I'd EVER had in my life!

We were so stuffed we couldn't even order another beer.  We were so food comatose that we had to get back to the Tropicana and take a nap before going out for the *night*...  And even though the service was HELLA slow (to use the parlance of our times), and the beer selection is essentially the LAST straw for a hophead, and it took the bar forever to call our return taxi...  I give C&A a proud 4.5 stars, especially since I fell in love with London a couple years ago and this joint is the closest thing to London for me :)

basically i'll never go back.

i was in vegas working a trade show and after a whirlwind teardown i had time for a mid-afternoon pint on my way to the airport.  i always wanted to try this place.  i walked in...nice atmosphere..what i expected.  all the seats at the bar were taken except for the ones at the video poker, which no one was playing. i walked up and DID NOT SIT DOWN.  the bartender (pretty, but pissed off looking) walks over to me and without a "hi" or anything says:
"are you playing?"....
"uh...no, i just want a black and tan."
"well you can't sit here if you're not playing!"
"okay...but i'm not sitting here, i'm standing.  can i just order a beer?"
"yeah, but you can't sit here!"
"i know...you just told me."

after the snot brought me my beer i downed it in about 3 gulps and walked out...never to return.

I was looking for a place away from all the overpriced places on the Strip and I had a hankering for fish and chips. Driving down E. Tropicana I saw the Crown and Anchor and it looked like just the place. 
The ambience is just what you'd expect except for the gambling machines that dominate the bar. Oh well , it is Vegas after all. I was greeted and seated immediately and the service remained very good throughout my meal.
The menu looked very tempting and included all of the standard British pub fair. I was very tempted to try the Steak and Mushroom pie, but I was there for the Fish and Chips.
The meal came out very quickly and looked delicious. The fish was maybe haddock and was well cooked, moist and flakey. However the batter had a bitter taste; maybe old oil or maybe aluminized baking powder in the batter, which I'm sensitive to. It was  not overwhelming, but enough that I would not order it again. The chips were great (which maybe points to the batter rater than the oil) and the included peas, well they were peas.
I gave  them a 3, but if I rated then strictly on this  meal it would have been lower. I do have a feeling a different night or a different entre may have been much better. I may give them another shot next time I am in Vegas, maybe the Steak and Mushroom pie  next time

It was my first time coming to this pub and I was actually kinda excited since we had just gotten out of a concert and were looking for somewhere to just chat and grab food and a beer. I went in with a group and we ordered our drinks at the bar. 

All the seats were full at the bar, but there was no one in the little restaurant area aside from the group outside and a few other people just chatting, not eating at a table not too far from where we decided to sit.

First off, we couldn't find someone to seat us which is why we just decided to find an area ourselves. Trying to get one of the waitresses' attention was another thing as well. 
They were darting so fast to the group outside that they completely disregarded us. 
Eventually, someone in our group just decided to try to get her attention because she was so flustered at the fact that we had been waiting so long and the only table that appeared to have ordered anything was a group outside.

I ended up ordering the Mozzarella sticks while everyone else got chicken fingers and/or curry.

Our meal took a good while. At least, it felt like it. We burned through so many conversations that I began to wonder if our server had gotten our order out.

She finally came around and brought us our food. Keep in mind that during this whole time, everyone at the table had already gotten through their drinks and she had walked past us quite a handful of times and not once even asked us if we wanted any other drinks.

Mozzarella sticks were the BOMB.com. 
The guys liked the chicken fingers, however, the curry order was wrong. It was ordered without chicken but had so much of it that our friend wasn't happy with it at all.

We finished our food (except the curry plate) and still had to wait for our server to even check up on us.
The service on a scale of 1-10 was at a 3 for me.
I completely understand that she was checking up constantly on the group outside, being that they were a larger group, but if I had known she wouldn't have shown us the same courtesy, I would've opted to go to another pub or bar instead.
Treat your customers right. All we wanted was to just be checked up on and offered drinks. It wouldn't have been anything complicated. What's annoying to me is that she preferred to give another group good service, but couldn't even provide us with basic service. How are you so sure we wouldn't have left a great tip for you just for checking up on us as you were darting by? Instead, we were ignored. 
The fact that it wasn't even busy, let alone she wasn't the only server there is just the icing on top of it all.

I'm not sure the food is worth coming back for.
In all honesty, I'm the type of person who if I go to a cool bar/pub/restaurant/etc. I always share it with people and bring them back with me.
My first experience was mediocre. Pretty disappointing.
In the meantime, I think I'll have to stick to Gold Spike or Park.

From the service to the food to the drinks, an all around outstanding bar. I'm never disappointed when I come in here. The bartenders I've met are always attentive to all the customers and make it a great experience. They really seem to love their jobs and it creates a wonderful atmosphere. After a long night at work it's nice to know I can unwind and enjoy their company.

I'm not one to yelp, EVER! I came into crown & anchor tonight. Ordered the best chicken fingers & mushroom steak pie. Our bartender Brian was beyond amazing! He recommend the best food & drinks. Would recommend it to all my friends in town! Thank you

Went here for dinner on our first night in Vegas.  It's a little restaurant off the strip and being an ex-pat I am always down for some tasty (read greasy) British grub.

They had a lot of comfort food that I remember from my youth.  Couldn't make up my mind on an app so I tried a Sausage roll and a Yorkshire Pudding.  The latter was very dry as if it had been cooked a few days ago and just warmed up.

I had a Blackthorn draft with Blackcurrent (originally asked for Ribena, but waitress had no idea what this was).

Can't remember exactly what my buddy ordered, I think it was some sort of stew.  I went with a Banger buddy (sausage sandwich) with chips.  All in all, not bad.  I wouldn't be rushing back here any time soon.

As a plus we were entertained by the two LVPD police officers who were dining next to us.  It was literally something out of Reno 911 as these two argued over the fact that one of them had never tried clam chowder and the other one was forcing him to sample from the bowl that he had ordered.

Great "local" bar..pool table, plenty of places for friends to sit, eat, and drink. 

Open till cows come home!

Ate here for my last night in Vegas. Experience was ok. Service was slow, and the food only eh. Ordered a snakebite, and got something else than what I thought I would. (Shame on me for not specifying.) Friends said that it's a good time during football (aka soccer) season.

Service was very slow. 20 minutes to brew a pot of coffee. Waitress took our order 5 minutes after delivering the coffee. 10 more minutes to deliver our meal. We both ordered fish and chips. Lots of large fries, lots of green peas, small single piece of fish. The fish was mediocre at best. Crispy breading but virtually  tasteless. In fact quite ordinary. We will not return.
Great fish n chips. Very fresh!  The batter is amazing, nice and crunchy. .it left me wanting another order..

First time i have ever done this, but i felt like i had to. I was in town for a week and while here looked online for good places to eat. Crown and Anchor showed up so we decided to give it a try. We came in on Monday night for the all you can eat. First off they need to update their prices online, for the amounts are different. To get on with the story though we walked right in and were able to sit down immediately which was nice. The waitress was at our table within 2 min or so and we ordered beverages and our food right away. My friends water was there within 3-5min or so, my coke however took almost 20 min to show up. After that it took another 20 min for our fish (keep in mind this was AYCE so the fish should be ready quick. After getting our fish, i kid you not it was 40 min before our waitress even stopped back needless to say we had been waiting and trying to ask her for fish for 20min at least. We talk to her and fish is there then somehow within only 5 min. It was then another 20 before we see her again and ask for our check. For anyone that took the time to read this, i really hope that we were an exception and nobody else goes through this. The service as a whole sucked. The people on either side sucked (relationship fighting, and a guy talking in a terrible British accent). In whole dinner took around 2 hours. The reason this even gets 1 star is that yes the Fish and Chips were very authentic. I will not be going back, but if you are willing go ahead and give it a try.

Reasons I like the Crown:
Late-night Hangin on the patio with a Guinness (or two)
Outstanding Fish and Chips (with Peas!)
Sticky Toffee Pudding (with custard on top if you ask nicely)
The Chip Butty (which I've never ordered, but just love the idea of butter-covered french fries on a hamburger bun)

Things I don't like:
Service is never what you'd call 'brisk'
The place could use a bit of a scrub
Patrons can be surly on game nights.
But what do ya want? It's a pub, right?

The perfect place to end a long evening on a warm spring night.

I had a good experience for each time I visited. The staff is friendly and very efficient. The quality of the food is good, and I cannot complain about the prices. I recommend this place for anyone wanting a pub environment or a late night drink.

Excellent prices and awesome fish n chips! It is located very close to the strip, about five minutes away from the MGM.

We went here on the day of the Queen's Jubilee and they had decorated the place with British flags and pictures of the Queen. Very cool. Best place to go to start out the night. It love how it wasn't rowdy at all and that the service was great. They also have a pool table and darts in the back :) Cool, laid-back atmosphere and good food. What more could you ask for?

If I lived in Vegas, this place would definitely be a staple for me :) I will have to go back the next time I am there!

Crisps with curry gravy and a cider, is the best ever.

Their chicken tenders are the best!

And a salad with beats - love the beats.

Las Vegas, Nevada ---

Day 99 "DUSA Tour 2016" ... bar #1

"Crown & Anchor Pub" was a British-themed sports bar 

menu is "extreme" British food , but not a "Run-A-Way Bill" food fare 

they have a "Down the Hatch" beer club, plus Happy Hour & Graveyard Hours specials 

No customer interaction other than TV interaction 

bartender/serves LK great in her Catholic-school (British) skirts 

my bartender did not introduced herself 

NOT  a "Run-A-Way Bill" Favorite, but mainly because I do not like USA sports, let alone British sports ...

#RunAwayBill #DUSATour2016 #LivingLarge 

"Run-A-Way Bill" was here!
07.18.16

We love coming here once a week with our pit bull Zeus.  They have an outdoor area perfect for dogs that is fenced in.  It's ideal and hard to find in this city.  The service is always great.  My husband loves the chicken fingers and fries.  I love their English Garden Salad.  I have never had a bad meal here.  When we come for breakfast which is served all day, they always bring Zeus some extra bacon and a sausage.  He loves this place.

WARNING: This is NOT an Arsenal bar. 

I got information about this as an "Arsenal bar" from Arsenal.com and decided to go on North London Derby day. 

You know, the day you'd expect the best Arsenal atmosphere...

The place was split 50/50 with Spuds fans and the TV situation was lame. 

The food was okay but I was strictly attending because of Arsenal, so I'm forced to let everyone know. 

I'm giving this place three stars as to not skew their rating, but I felt like I had to warn my fellow Gooners.

Three ***
I have lived lifetimes in the place. Great place to take years off your life, it's all worth it. Atmosphere, food, drinks, gambling. Heaven.

i was here last night, not to count the numerous previous visits. this is my friend's favorite pub! and it is my #2 pub for there delicious food. they got awesome apple cobblers, and cottage pie is my favorite dish here.  they got chimay on tab which is one of my favorite beer. everytime i go to this pub i get a kick out of it.  there are times like on the weekends where it will take a while for services but still the staff here is very friendly. :) i'll definitely be back!

Carpet has intense odor of beer/other things spilled on it.  If you like microwave frozen food, you'll love it here.  There's something "going on" in this place, like if I found out that there was 400 pounds of marijuana in the basement, it wouldn't surprise me. I think this is a hang out for local residents that are not allowed in casinos.
Really great little place.  Lovely chips and curry sauce!  Friendly staff, like a true pub as I remember from my time in England.

Tons of English dishes. The sausage rolls and scotch eggs were good. Avoid the Gammon, nothing like the English gammon more like a piece is Denny's ham the lamb was good. The Yorkshire pudding was a little too crispy.

This is by FAR the best place to watch football (soccer) in Las Vegas, if you're looking for something more than the glitzy experiences offered by the sports bars on the strip. If you want to watch football with real football fans, to hoot and holler, then Crown and Anchor is your place. 

They have a ton of European beers on tap, and they serve traditional British and Irish fare on the menu. I like the Chip Butty because, really, where else are you going to get a french fry and butter sandwich? But that's essentially what you have here: a french fry and butter sandwich. 

Fans of all clubs can go here and have a good time; it isn't an Arsenal bar or a Man United Bar. It's a football bar. So if you're staying on the strip, take a taxi here and watch some football, whether you're with your mates or by yourself.
Best Fish n' Chips in Vegas and maybe anywhere.  Light batter, thick and flaky fish.  Service usually blows (they don't staff many waitresses) but the food makes up for it.

Service sucks.  Their fries suck.  They don't even season them with anything in the kitchen.  

I can get better fries at McDonald's.  

The table beside me ordered fish n' chips and it's literally 1 piece of fish and a plate full of fries.  That is insane.  You could at least put 3-4 pieces of fish.

Their menu is too big.  I hate it when a menu is a novel.  I see this a lot in Vegas.  They need to cut it down and focus on just a few premier dishes that they do really really well.  

No need for 4 pages of food if you do 7 dishes really really well and just knock it out of the park.

I would probably give this place between a 3.5 stars and a 4.0.

Food: I had an avocado and turkey sandwich that came with French fries. I thought the avocado was fine, but the bread was a bit dry. I would have preferred less fries and instead maybe a cold slaw side or some salad side accompanying it. 3.0 for the food.

Beer: Both my friend and I had the summer ale. I have to say that it was pretty good. I forgot to ask them if they brewed it themselves, but this pub has an extensive list of beer including imports. The summer ale is a special and it included a dose of citrus. Pretty good light beer. I normally don't drink and even I thought this was refreshing.

Service: Our waitress was very friendly. She also invited my friend and I to the quiz night going on that evening even though we did not go to it. The outfits at this pub are pretty cute- note very short plaided skirts. The food was brought out relatively fast along with the beer.

Parking: Ample parking in a private lot (free).

Payment: Takes credit card.

Location: It's off strip and pretty close to the freeway. One can probably take a cab here or drive here if you have a car.

Overall, the pub was pretty friendly and our waitress was awesome. The food was okay, but the beer made up for it. I also filled out a survey with comments and it will be entered for a $25 gift card to the pub.
Love this spot, always have a great time going here, sooooo many great beers on tap and love playing darts!!

Love me some crown and anchor. 

The last 2 times I have been in I get the chicken fingers and fries. These are some of the best chicken fingers around. Really good. 

This also a good place to grab a drink and hang out with friends. If you are a soccer fan there almost always seems to be a game on. 

If you like fish and chips Monday night is your night. It's all you can eat fish and chips. This are also very good. 

Last but not least Thursday night at this location is bad singer night. If you like to karoke than this is the place to be. If you like hearing your favorite song ruined also the place to be. 

I am a fan of crown and anchor.
Love the ambiance of this german pub bartenders and patrons are super friendly! May have found my new watering hole!

Here is yet another of my favorite places oh I miss Vegas now. I need to update these reviews when I am there not get back lol! 

I love this place sometimes a band great home cooked tasting food, and beer selections and cider and current ohhh.. Out side seating clean and affordable and the darts are supper fun.

I LOVE THIS PLACE

1st  time I was here I saw that the waitress's were skinny girls in skirts, and I made the mistake of thinking that these girls were going to be lazy and not care about the fat people sitting in the back. I WAS WRONG... this is one of the hardest working wait-staffs in Vegas, they don't stop moving, and are constantly getting what you ask for. To top it off, they still make you table, no matter how large the amount of the people or how large the people... or both, feel like they are the only Table.

This is the best Fish&chips you will find in this city, I have been looking for years for this quality of fish&chips. The Fish by the way is HUGE and cooked perfectly.  When I come on a Monday, I gain a good 40lbs due to the all you can eat Fish&Chips, then some how stuff a Toffe pudding in my mouth for dessert.
I loved the food and the atmosphere. The service was great and even though it was loud because it happened to be karaoke night, it was great

Cozy bar with lots of English beers on tap. Bartender has a "Locals Only" chip on his shoulder but was gratious and pleasant. Monday night all-you-can-eat Fish N Chips. Good drinking hole for those who prefer Vegas the city, not The Strip.

As any soccer fan living in the United States can attest to, being a fan of The Beautiful Game in this country can be quite a lonely experience.  From the quizzical looks I get when I wear my Cesc Fabregas Arsenal jersey in public, to the "huh?" I get from bartenders at other bars when I ask if they can put a soccer match on, being a soccer fan is sometimes like being the red-headed stepchild.

Which is why I love this place so much.  Simply put, this is the best British Pub I have ever been to.  It isn't a big bar by most standards, but it's very homely and it just feels warm to be inside.  They have pool, darts and foosball for those interested in bar games.  They do have video poker like in most bars these days, but this is a bar better for socializing or watching a match than playing poker.  

I just got back today from watching Arsenal play Barcelona in a UEFA Champions League match, and while the place was pretty empty when I got there 20 minutes before match time, practically all the seats were taken by kickoff.  The British Burger I ordered was absolutely delicious, and next time I must try the fish and chips.  Even though it was noonish, the people watching the match were rowdy and fun, and despite the intensity of a hugely important match were for the most part friendly.  While the fans are passionate and intense, you probably don't have to worry about brawls breaking out.

The only bad thing I can say about this place is that the parking lot of quite small and cramped.  If you're going here to watch a match, be sure to get there early, as it fills pretty fast, particularly if it's a popular club or country playing (I.E. Manchester United, Chelsea, Liverpool, Arsenal or England's National Team).  Besides, the smaller lot probably encourages designated driving, so you can experience those many beers and get home safely :)

PROS:
-Authentic British pub decor
-Wide selection of beers 
-Plenty of bar games
-Great Food!
-Soccer, er, Football fans!

CONS:
Small, cramped parking lot.

I love Crown and Anchor. It's one of my favorite local bars. But it also sucks, in a fun way. Great atmosphere. Fair service. Smoke in your eyes. Horrid food...  I've tried everything but order the fish and chips to feel authentic lol. Stop putting those gross pees on the plate! P.S. They always override my songs on the the jukebox. Don't have them on there then! They aren't cheap.

I've been really excited to come to the crown and anchor pub for a while now. When the opportunity presented itself we visited this location for lunch. Our waitress was amazing. She was extremely friendly and personable. Atmosphere gets an A+. I had the fish and chips as the main course; which was DE. LI. CIOUS. They've definitely done it justice. Here is the bad news... My Yorkshire pudding was burnt. The gravy was tasty but it couldn't mask the taste of char. That lost you a star. The second star disappeared when I wanted to get them to redeem themselves by trying the sticky toffee pudding (one of my favourites.) Unfortunately it was dry and had the same light burnt taste. I'm pretty sure it was old. The ice cream accompanying it was also freezer burnt. Very disappointed...
Food was pretty good and our server was nice. It's a little far from the strip but was a nice change of pace.

Stilton Plate and Fullers London Pride pale ale...who wouldve thought that just stilton cheese(like blue cheese), cucumbers, and tomato slices would taste so good!! Also the sticky toffee bread pudding was AMAZING! I ordered two...oops ;)
Worse service ever they lack waitresses and take forever to take your order and drinks. The bartender needs to chill on his attitude and stop using his phone I believe his name was Jason.

Food was great but service was terrible. Pop was out for the entire restaurant and the waitress gave no refills on WATER. The restaurant was not overly busy as it was early afternoon but we only saw the waitress three times. We asked for the bill several times and was ignored. We had a game to get to and should not have to wait nearly 20 minutes to get our bill so we could leave. This was our first time eating here and after the horrible service it will be our last. 

Per reply from Richard: I wrote this while in the restaurant that afternoon.

good service, friendly staff and tasty food. although we ordered wings and got strips. whatever. it was like 430 am and any food tasted good. i just remember the waiter/bartender was really really nice. and he said we could smoke even though there was a sign that said no smoking :)

Always fun to be at this location. Leslie the bartender is super nice and we always sit at the bar to chat with her as well. Love the home made kettle cooked chips here. I wish they served liquor at the bar, but we can do with beer and Leslie's company.

Finally! Some decent beers on tap! Odd that you can only drink beer at the bar; cocktails are allowed in the dining areas. Attentive staff. Good goth music the night I was there. Really near the Pinball Hall of Fame.
The pub is pretty typical, but the food is outstanding! One thing I like is that they don't try to over do the "English" pub thing...   The decor is themed, but it's not overboard.

Ever imaged an oasis in the Las Vegas desert? Well, here it is! Great English pub with food and beers to match! The bartenders are nice and the beers are cold. I also tried the sticky toffee pudding and it was pretty average but much appreciated nonetheless.

I love this place! Its one of the few British Pubs that actually has a whole gang of Brits hanging out all the time. It may have something to do with the constant showing of Rugby and Football matches on the flat screens, or it could have something to do with the 50 or so ale's they have on tap each one being a treat or maybe the pretty tasty english fare on the menu.  
I pick all of the above. 
I have been here so many times the past 14 years and never been disappointed. The beer is good, the food is delicious.  The atmosphere is lively and fun a great local places, a great place to get something on tap that is actually worth drinking!

i've been back here several times and i've never been disappointed.

came here a couple nights ago and i had the chicken fingers. this is one of my favorite places to get chicken fingers. 

the service was better than any other time i have been here. but it was almost to the point of annoying. i think we were asked how everything was going a minimum of 6 times. our server asked the most but then someone else came and asked too. my friend and i were having a conversation so it was a little annoying to keep having someone come up and ask how everything was going. our answer was always the same because neither of us had ordered anything extra and we were fine with our drinks.

anyhoo.. as i said. my friend denise and i always come here when i'm in town :)

First things first: this isn't fast food, it's a place to visit for an extended, leisurely hang. If you're in a hurry, look elsewhere.
My wife and I brought our Dachshund "Dug" here for lunch yesterday, as they welcome pets on their patio. 
The food was perfect, and our server Giselle was very friendly to us all, as she started off by bringing our dog fresh water. Nice!
My only gripe was that the entrance to the patio was a mud pit from the recent rains... Maybe some stones to walk on would help?
Homesick Brits and Anglophiles should seek this place out for their fix.

Don't get me wrong I love a good dive But this was just ok. Nothing terrible but you can typically get most of the items in any generic "pub." My friend that I went with didn't care for the fish and chips. I got mozzarella sticks and they were ok. My fiancé enjoyed the fries though. It was fair price wise but I wouldn't make a point to return. The service was standard.

As a British Ex-pat this is the closest thing i have to being home in Vegas. 

The food is good, although they do seem to have issues making a decent custard to go with the sticky toffee pudding (come on how difficult is it to boil a kettle and mix in the custard powder until it's smooooooooth!!!) anyhoo the atmosphere is authentic, right down to the slightly stinky toilets (a staple in any British pub!) and the chalk boards (so you can write humorous japes to your mates!) 

The beer is good and plentiful; although they did run out of St George Ale just before St Georges day (that's what i call bad planning!) and the selection covers most of the known world; why they even have some luke warm gnats piss that the yanks know as beer! (Lol I'm gonna get lunched now!! ;p ) 

The best thing is on Mondays they do ALL YOU CAN EAT FISH AND CHIPS, OK so it doesn't come with mushy peas, but it's a damn good representation of the dish, and they do use cod (none of that haddock b@llocks here my friends.) 

The appetisers are a little odd, sausage roll, chip butty and scotch eggs to name a few; for those of you who think this is standard faire will be sadly mistaken. A scotch egg and sausage roll is used for picnicking and the chip butty is a cheap student dinner. A true British appetiser or starter is...prawn cocktail with Marie rose sauce, Heinz cream of tomato soup, stuffed garlic mushrooms and pate on toast (not all together of course!!), the main dishes are more authentic, i can recommend the steak and mushroom pie and the roast dinner on Sundays ONLY!!

There's not much else to say about this place; apart from their world cup coverage was super and they served $4 pints of Stella!! 

Wankers away my friends, wankers away!
one of the places I truly enjoy drinking and eating. the staff is always chill and nice. and if this is as close as what I can get to British Pub food hey sounds dope to me.

All I can say is Love this place. Been coming for awhile for the Ol'Speckeled Hen on Nitro. New to yelp so I figured I would give a shout to a truly great pub they deserve it. Great Fare! English pub food Scotch Eggs kidney pie. Leslie is a great Bartender friendly hospitable and super on it. Over all Crown is worth the trip and if  Soccer or Rugby is your gig its a must...Slainte!!!

Brought my wife here for lunch, the waitress looked at us and walked by us three times and made eye.contact each time (Erica) and finally I had to loudly call out "excuse me ms.!" To get her attention. After we got our orders my meat and liver pie was great however everything else was terrible. The chicken was drie the mashed potatoes were dry, the peas werent thoroughly cooked and the service continued to be less than even average... I doubt Ill ever convince my wife to come here again...

Stopped by there today for the first time after reading some positive reviews.  Was craving some fish & chips.  Terrible! Frozen battered fish throw in a deep fryer.  Chips weren't even double fried.  Forgot my tartar sauce even though I asked for it when ordering.  Three bites, then covered it with a napkin paid and left. Never again.
Don't know if they got new cooks or what but fish and chips came out cold and my burger came out missing top bun... Haven't been here in 2 months but food taste different

Went here last night and did not have an enjoyable experience. After waiting for more than ten minutes to be acknowledged at the bar I was yelled at by the WWE looking "bartender" for trying to order a vodka cran. He abruptly yelled "no, you can't have that. We only do wine and beer at the bar."  Fair enough, but post a sign or be nice explaining that to your customers. Especially when you are working for tips. Also, the interior is completely run down and disgusting.

This is NOT the place to come if you're looking for a spot to throw. During my last trip out to sin city, some friends and I were looking for a chill lil dive bar to grab a drink and throw some steel tip darts. This was one of the spots that came up in conversation w a local bar hopper as well as on a Yelp search. We thought we'd give this spot a chance. 

Hmm, this place was very UNDERwhelming.
The waitresses here aren't the most helpful. They don't seem too knowledgeable when it comes to knowing whether or not they have certain brews on draught or if they have ginger beer, etc. They also take too long to ask if you need help. Poor service!!!

There also seemed to be some odd "rules" here about where they could and couldn't serve alcoholic beverages. They said it had something to do with their liquor license but it sounded like some BS to us. 

Having been the DD, I decided to order a soda. Yuck!!!! The syrup was not only gone but it tasted old and spoiled almost. That was disgusting. I sent that back and just had water. 

We threw a few games of cricket and called it quits. The score boards weren't at all in good shape. The boards were super beat up too. The bull line was real worn out. I knew this spot was dicey but this was pretty bad. I doubt I'll be back.

Sorry but you are in VEGAS and I have to go to a table and order food to be served liquor? We had just had a great dinner and great drinks elsewhere, decided we wanted to go have a few drinks and some fun. Found this place, went up to the bar ordered a round of Jamisons which we were told we could only have if we had a table and ordered food. Ended up having a round of beer and leaving with a very very unhappy date.

The fish and chips were very fresh and well cooked, great beer garden and prices were reasonable at around $4-$5 for entrees and mains from $11. Great variety of beer on tap as well as imported British beer. Will dine there again!

I can say this is probably one of my new favorite places. I came across this place by sheer luck when I was craving some sort of shepherds pie and didn't feel like driving up to the Irish pubs I frequent in town. "English people eat that shit too!" I told myself as I made an illegal u-turn in the middle of Tropicana. (ok no I didn't but it adds to the story right?)

The place has a really cool set up, there's a restaurant and bar area, and also a dart board (for the not too rowdy) The bartender Adam (I think?) was really nice and was ready to explain anything on the menu we had questions about. The good service continued the second time I had returned here, the waitresses are friendly and quick with orders. 

I'm the type of person that likes to eat a crapton of food while I drink, cause I'm a fat bastard, and the delicious food here is more than enough for me to get my fill. The cottage pie is probably my favorite thing on their menu, along with plenty of Yorkshire pudding and gravy sauce. I'm getting hungry just typing this. I told you I was a fat bastard.

I love this bloody place!

One of the few places in Vegas that I honestly miss.  The all you can eat English fish & chips (Monday night), chicken curry, chicken & leek pie and Lancashire hot pot are some of my favorite menu items.  Big beer selection and full bar lacking the typical douchebag Vegas tourist is a huge plus.  Most of the out-of-towners are here visiting with a local. 

Friendly, prompt waitresses and bartenders do their job well.  Parking can be a bitch at times but that's the only negative that comes to mind.  Oh...that and the mens bathroom sink's water pressure is up pretty high so when you turn it on, you get splashed in the front of your pants making it look like you wee'd on yourself.

Crown & Anchor has done a damn fine job making you feel as if you are in an authentic "British Pub"  so much so that you forget you are still in Vegas (which is a good thing.)  

Cheers!

One of the few British Pubs that serve my favorite beer, Boddingtons, and they have an excellent choice of British Pub favorites. Never had a bad experience here and love the place. Recommend the fish and chips, the chicken curry and the Ploughman's lunch. Must Do Vegas Haunt!

I had lunch here with work folks. Had the bangers and mash and they had fish and chips. Was good with decent service. Only wish I had a beer to wash it down but maybe next time. Noticed several customers with a British accent so that was a good sign.
I've been coming here for over 15 years and I just love it! I've even got the Fiancé hooked, too! For a great dessert, try the sticky toffee pudding. =)

I love this place because- i can go there anytime!!! i can ride my bike up to the back patio! i LOVE the patio!!!! You can have an awesome dinner for two and seriously spend under 25 dollars. The staff is friendly , the waitresses wear short skirts but act like ladies. Its not a 4 star english dining experience if thats what you are looking for its a laid back fun pub with a dart board and a bad ass beer selection!  and delish food. Bangers and mash are good, and the chips are always light and crunchy .

Weve been going to vegas for 15 years and just discovered this place last wrek. We went specifically for the fishn chips because the fish weve been getting at Ellis island is so greasy!  Our fish was delicious! We just got one piece but it was a big ass fat piece crispy, lightly battered and most delicious. Steak fries were yummy and they have what tasted like the make it yourself ranch dressing, yum! Peas had no seasoning but not a big deal salt and pepper were right there on the table! Our server Tracy was fantastic and treated us well, we will most definately be back. They also have Pepsi products as most places do when you get off the strip. Well done Crown, well done. Now if they would just take down those redskin banners...Lol
When you enter the restaurant the smoke odor is overwhelming.  The tables a little sticky.  The restaurant needs a good cleaning.  The wait staff is very professional.  The food is ok.
